column1: I love my women like i love my ikea furniture, cheap and missing a couple screws
column3: screws refers to both fasteners used in furniture assembly and implies a playful metaphor related to relationships.
column4: The carpenter used screws to assemble the wooden shelves securely.
column5: The curious child watched as the screws in the relationship began to cause tension.

column1: What does the Mexican gang member say to the 15-page document? hey, *essay*!
column3: essay refers to a written composition and is used humorously to refer to the gang members greeting to a document.
column4: The student spent all night writing an essay for her English class.
column5: The professor praised the complexity of the essay presented at the conference.

column1: What do you call a midget Mexican? a paragraph since he isnt a full essay
column3: paragraph means a distinct section of written text, and humorously refers to a person in a non-standard way.
column4: The professor asked the students to write a well-structured paragraph for their assignment.
column5: The books chapter was divided into multiple paragraphs for easier readability.

column1: Doctor: Your x-ray showed a broken rib... ... but we fixed it with photoshop.
column3: fix means to repair something and is played on in the joke regarding an image editing tool.
column4: The technician can fix the broken machinery with the right tools.
column5: The artist can fix the colors in the digital image using software.

column1: What do you call a happy Russian? gladimir putin!
column3: glad refers to feeling happiness, and its used in a humorous context to play on the name Vladimir.
column4: She felt glad when she received good news from her friend.
column5: The child was glad to see his favorite cartoon was on TV.
